unnormalised: So, someone asked about learning software development in India, right? Well, let me tell you, it's a booming field! You've got tons of opportunities. First, figure out what you wanna build – websites? Apps? Games? That'll guide your language choice. Python's super popular, easy to learn, and used by big companies like TCS and Infosys. Java’s still a big deal too, especially in enterprise-level apps – think SBI banking apps and stuff.

unnormalised: For courses, you can look into IIT certifications or check out online platforms like Coursera. They have courses from Stanford and all that, but also local instructors. If you're going the self-taught route, YouTube's your friend. Just search for "Python tutorial for beginners" or "Java programming" – you'll find a gazillion videos. Plus, sites like Stack Overflow are lifesavers when you hit a wall with your code. Don’t be shy to ask qns!

unnormalised: Finally, networking is key. Attend tech meetups in your city - Bangalore, Mumbai, Delhi have loads. Join online communities. Contributing to open-source projects (find some on GitHub!) looks amazing on your resume. And don’t forget to build a portfolio. Even simple projects – a calculator app or a to-do list – show you can actually code. Good luck, bhai!
